lines.text:
[singing]
Tra-la-la-la-la-la-la-la you've come to wash my face!

[singing in return]
Tra-la-la-la-la-la-la-la we've come to wash your face!
Land's sakes, what's he trying to do, landscape you?
What are you doing, playing one-nighters in dressing rooms?
You're human aren't you?
I hope not!
Can't you see I love you and want you for the father of my children?
I didn't know you had any!
You remind me of one of those girls in Esquire, the ones with clothes on, of course.
Next time I get hitched it's for dough.
Hey, Slim! Watch your hat? Watch your derby?
Money ain't changed *me*, I'm still lovable!
I see you want to buy me.
Gosh no, Miss Daly, I want to marry you!
What's this?
Your breakfast, Sire.
Well, who eats who?
What's the setup around here, am I really the King?
Anyone who says you ain't, dies.
Don't you know that kings can do no wrong?
That's my plan!
He's mad about me!
They're all mad, about you!
Who dares to interfere?
Me! My Majesty!
Be brave, my friend, you're dying for your country.
Yeah, but I was born in the city!
Get your Daily Chopping Guide! You can't tell which head is which without a program!
That's OK, he's snapping back to abnormal now.
You never look at me like that.
You never look like that.
She's just excited. She's never married me before.
We'll slip him a Rooney.
A Rooney? What's that?
It's a high-powered Mickey.
You know, it's too bad May couldn't marry for love *and* money.
You mean sort of a double wedding?
Here's to I, May, and you - the eternal rectangle. If this was back in the glorious days of France, I would be King Louis, May would be Du Barry, and you would be one of the common folks - a peasant.
Hey! Men don't kiss men!
They do in France, Pop.
How embarrassing, to be found hiding behind a woman's skirts.
Du Barry! That jay! That jezebel! That spoiler of kings!
Isn't he wonderful?
Does she love the king? No! She loves rubies! So your children go hungry! She loves silks! So your wives go naked!

[dreamily]
Look at his eyes.
We'll give him a fair trial. Then we'll hang him.
For parading without a license each of you gets thirty days. For planning to knock me off, you get the guillotine.

[about May Daly]
Isn't she wonderful?
What's so wonderful about her? Take away her eyes, her nose, her lips, and what have you got? A blank expression.
I trust my appearance pleases you.
Wait a minute, son, how old are you?
Hey, that doesn't make sense! I'm only 28!

[talking about Willie]
Why, he's got more lettuce than in a victory garden!
